DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: This page contains brief information about daratumumab and hyaluronidase-fihj and a collection of links to more information about the use of this drug, research results, and ongoing clinical trials.
DrugInfoMetaData.FDAExternalRef: FDA label information for this drug is available at DailyMed.

Para.ExternalRef: FDA label information for this drug is available at DailyMed.

Section.Title: Use in Cancer
Section.Para: Daratumumab and hyaluronidase-fihj is approved to be used alone or with other drugs to treat adults with:

ItemizedList.ListItem: light-chain amyloidosis that is newly diagnosed. It is used with bortezomib, cyclophosphamide, and dexamethasone.¹

multiple myeloma: For newly diagnosed cancer, it is used:with bortezomib, dexamethasone, and either thalidomide or lenalidomide in patients who can receive an autologous stem cell transplant with bortezomib, melphalan, and prednisone or with lenalidomide and dexamethasone in patients who cannot receive an autologous stem cell transplantFor cancer that has come back or did not respond to treatment, it is used:with dexamethasone and either lenalidomide or bortezomib in patients who have received at least one therapywith pomalidomide and dexamethasone in patients who have received at least one therapy that included lenalidomide and a proteasome inhibitorwith carfilzomib and dexamethasone in patients who have received one to three types of therapyalone in patients who have already received at least three types of therapy that included a proteasome inhibitor and an immunomodulating agent or whose cancer did not respond to a proteasome inhibitor and an immunomodulatory agent

Section.Para: ¹This use is approved under FDA’s Accelerated Approval Program. As a condition of approval, confirmatory trial(s) must show that daratumumab and hyaluronidase-fihj provides a clinical benefit in these patients.

Daratumumab and hyaluronidase-fihj is a form of daratumumab that is given as a subcutaneous injection. This form can be given in less time than daratumumab, which is given as an infusion. For more information about daratumumab that may apply to daratumumab and hyaluronidase-fihj, see the Drug Information Summary for Daratumumab.
Daratumumab and hyaluronidase-fihj is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.

Section.Para: Drugs are often studied to find out if they can help treat or prevent conditions other than the ones they are approved for. This patient information sheet applies only to approved uses of the drug. However, much of the information may also apply to unapproved uses that are being studied.

Section.Title: Clinical Trials Accepting Patients
Section.Para: Find Clinical Trials for Daratumumab And Hyaluronidase-fihj - Check for trials from NCI's list of cancer clinical trials now accepting patients.

DrugInfoDisclaimer.Para: Important: The drug information on this page is meant to be educational. It is not a substitute for medical advice. The information may not cover all possible uses, actions, interactions, or side effects of this drug, or precautions to be taken while using it. Please see your health care professional for more information about your specific medical condition and the use of this drug.
